text: Hello, Can someone help me with this? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Couldn-t-complete-the-connection-An-error-occurred-while/m-p/801614/highlight/true#M64535>
I get this error. I am assuming since the association isn't bidirectional (company_to_task), i can only access the task object via company and not the other way around.
can you share your request URL?

We have a Typeform form, on a page, that’s integrated with HubSpot which automatically creates a form and records the submission data in the HubSpot form. Is there any way to get that form submission associated with the page as well though? Despite there being submissions, it shows 0 form submissions on the page analytics in HubSpot.

*SOURCE TRACKING:* Wondering if anyone here can help me determine whether or not <https://marriottresidences.com/luxury_brand/ritz-carlton-reserve-residences/|this webpage> lacks any attributes that keep it from registering as a source when they click on the “Siari, A Ritz-Carlton Residence” model when you hover over Mexico.

All i wanted was to get both company information and task information together for a bunch of companies. Why is this so complicated or am i missing something ? This is my current process.
1. Search for companies with a specific condition. (Returns ~2k companies. Can’t get associations in the same call)
2. Process each company id and get related tasks. (Batch api doesn't have associations parameter)
3. Batch read tasks using the task ids obtained.
4. Merge the 2 results.
I believe Typeform embeds via an iframe, so the answer is probably “no dice” — however, this has been a problem for me a few times recently, so I’d love to hear if anyone can prove me wrong.

Is there any sort of dedicated or official channel for delivering feedback on betas? I’d love to be able to say my piece on the new CMS page editor interface, but want to make sure it’s going in the right place.
Lol didn't even check the link. There use to be a form for feedback. Not sure where you'd leave it now
Ah, a bit of a bummer, but I suppose I’ll go whine wherever I can find an ear to listen, then. :innocent:
